did.abstract: Two handwritten copies of military commission letters issued to Benjamin Hewlett, Jr. by William Tryon in 1772 and 1776. The letters appoint Hewlett to the ranks of Junior Lieutenant Captain and Captain in the Queens County Militia.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small collection is housed in a single folder.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Benjamin Hewlett, Jr. was a resident of Queens County in the Province of New York who served in the Queens County Militia.
William Tryon (1729-1788) was a British soldier who served as Governor of the British provinces of North Carolina (1765-1771) and New York (1771-1780).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Benjamin Hewlett, Jr. commission papers, 1977.522, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level. This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Two handwritten copies of military commission letters issued to Benjamin Hewlett, Jr. by William Tryon in 1772 and 1776. The letters appoint Hewlett to the ranks of Junior Lieutenant Captain and Captain in the Queens County Militia. The author of the copies is not known.
